tool_metadata.name: get_finance_extraction_guide
tool_metadata.purpose: Extract 9 finance-relevant data points from contracts for DuraCube's accounts receivable and project accounting team
tool_metadata.design_principle: EXTRACT ONLY - no assessment, no comparison, no judgment

business_context.industry: Australian construction materials supplier (concrete, precast, structural elements)
typical_contracts: Subcontract agreements (DuraCube as subcontractor to head contractor)
business_context.regulatory_context: Subject to Security of Payment legislation (SOP Act)

target_audience.team: Accounts receivable and project accounting team
target_audience.use_case: Accurate data extraction to set up contracts in financial systems

extraction_categories.name: Contract Value (Excluding GST)
extraction_categories.description: The total contract price excluding GST
extraction_rules: Extract the exact amount excluding GST
Note if GST treatment is specified separately
If only GST-inclusive amount given, extract that and note 'GST-inclusive only'
Do NOT calculate GST from totals

extraction_categories.name: Contract Parties
extraction_categories.description: All parties to the contract with their business identifiers
extraction_rules: Extract all parties to the contract
Include ABN (11 digits) or ACN (9 digits) for each party
Note the role of each party (Principal, Head Contractor, Contractor, Subcontractor, Supplier)

output_fields.parties: array - List of party objects with name, role, ABN/ACN

extraction_categories.name: Payment Terms
extraction_categories.description: Payment frequency, timing, and claim due dates
extraction_rules: Extract payment frequency (monthly, progress-based, milestone, upon completion)
Extract payment timing from claim submission (e.g., 'within 30 days of valid claim')
Extract claim due date (e.g., 'by the 25th of each month')
Extract reference period for claims
Do NOT infer dates from durations

output_fields.claim_due_date: string - When claims must be submitted

extraction_categories.name: Payment Claim Conditions
extraction_categories.description: Required documents and conditions for valid payment claims
extraction_rules: Extract required supporting documents for valid claim
Extract conditions precedent to payment entitlement
Extract invoice submission email address or portal
Extract tax invoice requirements

output_fields.conditions_precedent: array - Conditions that must be met
output_fields.submission_email: string or null - Email for invoice submission
output_fields.tax_invoice_requirements: string or null - Tax invoice requirements

extraction_categories.name: Retention and Securities
extraction_categories.description: Retention percentages, security types, and release conditions
extraction_rules: Extract retention percentage (typically 5% or 10%)
Extract maximum retention amount (often capped)
Extract security type required (bank guarantee, cash retention, insurance bond)
Extract security amount or formula
Extract release conditions and timing
Do NOT calculate security amounts from percentages

output_fields.retention_cap: string or null - Maximum retention amount

extraction_categories.name: Additional Claim Documentation
extraction_categories.description: Extra documentation required for claims beyond standard invoices
extraction_rules: Extract Subcontractor Statement requirements (NSW/VIC specific)
Extract Daily Order Records (DORs) or variation documentation requirements
Extract delivery dockets or proof of delivery requirements
Extract quality certificates or test results requirements
Extract any other claim prerequisites

output_fields.subcontractor_statement: string - Required, Not required, or State-specific requirement
output_fields.other_requirements: array - List of other documentation requirements

extraction_categories.name: Claim Submission Method
extraction_categories.description: How and where to submit payment claims
extraction_rules: Extract submission portal URL (e.g., Procore, Aconex, Oracle)
Extract submission email address
Extract hard copy requirements
Extract specific formatting requirements

output_fields.method: string - Portal, Email, Hard copy, or Multiple
output_fields.special_requirements: string or null - Any specific instructions

extraction_categories.name: Project Manager
extraction_categories.description: Assigned project manager or contract administrator
extraction_rules: Extract name of assigned Project Manager or Contract Administrator
Extract company they represent
Extract contact details (email, phone if provided)

extraction_categories.name: Dollar Value Mentions
extraction_categories.description: All monetary amounts mentioned in the contract
extraction_rules: List EVERY monetary ($) amount mentioned in the contract
Include the page number for each amount
Include brief context for what each amount relates to

output_fields.amounts: array - List of amount objects with value, context, and page

document_scan_order.section: Special Conditions / Particular Conditions / Annexure A

extraction_rules: Scan the ENTIRE document - do not skip any sections
Follow the priority order but capture data from ALL sections
If the same data point appears in multiple places with different values, extract ALL instances and note each location
Always include page number AND clause reference (e.g., 'Page 5, Clause 8.1')
For schedules, include schedule reference (e.g., 'Schedule A, Item 3')

conflicting_values.description: When different sections state different values for the same data point
conflicting_values.action: Extract ALL instances with their sources and set status to 'CONFLICT_DETECTED'

example.note: Multiple values found - manual verification required

handwritten_amendments.description: When handwritten notes, strikethroughs, or manual amendments are visible
handwritten_amendments.action: Document the amendment with location, description, and legibility assessment

example.description: Handwritten change to payment terms - '30' crossed out, '45' written

external_references.description: When the contract references external documents not included
external_references.action: Document the reference with the document name, relevance, and location

example.relevance: Payment terms stated as 'back-to-back with Head Contract'

conditional_values.description: When values depend on conditions or formulas
conditional_values.action: Extract the formula/condition as stated, do NOT calculate

example.note: Formula extracted as stated - not independently calculated

not_found.description: When a data point cannot be located after thorough search
not_found.action: Return null value with NOT_FOUND status and list of search terms used

style_requirements.abbreviations: No abbreviations except standard ones (ABN, ACN, GST, NSW, VIC)

extraction_metadata.document_type: string - Subcontract, Supply Agreement, or Other

json_structure.categories: object - All 9 extraction categories with their output fields

edge_cases.external_references: array - List of external document references

json_structure.extraction_notes: string - Factual observations about document quality or structure

validation_checklist: All 9 categories have been addressed (either with data or NOT_FOUND)
Every extracted value has a source reference (Page X, Clause X.X)
NOT_FOUND entries include search terms used
No values have been calculated or derived (only extracted)
No assessments or judgments have been included
Conflicting values (if any) are flagged with all instances
Document name and extraction date are included
All dollar amounts have been captured with context

do_not: Calculate GST from totals - extract GST-inclusive or exclusive as stated
Infer end dates from start + duration - extract dates exactly as stated
Assume 'standard' terms if not stated - mark as NOT_FOUND
Judge terms as favorable/unfavorable - extract without commentary
Summarize or paraphrase - quote exact contract language
Skip sections that look irrelevant - scan entire document
Guess at illegible text - note as 'ILLEGIBLE' in handwritten_amendments
Calculate security amounts from percentages - extract formula as stated

regulatory_knowledge: Security of Payment Act (SOP Act) terminology and payment claim conventions
Building and Construction Industry Security of Payment legislation by state

terminology.retention: Amount withheld from progress payments until project milestones
terminology.practical_completion: PC - when works are complete except for minor defects
terminology.defects_liability_period: DLP - period after PC during which contractor must fix defects
terminology.bank_guarantee: BG - security instrument from contractor's bank
terminology.progress_claim: Periodic claim for work completed during reference period
terminology.subcontractor_statement: NSW/VIC statutory declaration of worker entitlements compliance
